newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Republican senators praise budget accord.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Republican senators praise budget accord.

text.p: Senate Republicans said Tuesday they were generally pleased with the balanced budget and tax cut deal worked out with the White House, and said they expected it would pass with overwhelming support from their party.

Sen. Phil Gramm of Texas, who had held out for larger tax cuts, said he was now inclined to support that portion of hte bill as the total was now around $90 billion in net tax cuts over five years. But he added he might not vote for the spending cut bill due to its Medicare provisions. "We are not doing enough to reform Medicare," he told reporters.
